results.title: And I cried
results.brief_description: We live in a world besieged and besotted by image. Everyone, it seems, wants their fifteen minutes and plenty of people will do whatever it takes to get a piece of the celebrity cake. “And I cried” is a film about wishing to be a movie star. Being a star is about shining bright, a brilliant flash of light against a velvety black night sky. “And I cried” is an exploration, a celebration, a lamentation, of our obsession with the star and the image. Cast includes: Cassandra Tytler, Engelbert Schmidl, Dominic Redfern, Shane Hennessey.

results.title: Angels of war
results.creator_credit: Andrew Pike, Gavan Daws, Hank Nelson and Australian National University. Research School of Pacific Studies
results.brief_description: Papua New Guinea men recount their experiences when war came to their islands in 1942. During three years a million Americans, 300,000 Japanese and nearly half a million Australians fought their way across the country. Cut into their memories are archival film sequences shot by Japanese, American and Australian cameramen and the songs and poems of black men and white writing about life and death in time of war. Now the men speak passionately of the white man’s promises, made to them in war and never kept in peace.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew Pike, Gavan Daws, Hank Nelson and Australian National University. Research School of Pacific Studies

results.title: Angel in the house
results.creator_credit: Jane Jackson and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: The film takes as its theme an essay by Virginia Woolf written in 1927. In the essay Virginia Woolf talks about women writers and the psychological and social barriers to their creativity and their self-confidence. In 1977, the film’s protagonist Lily Ramsey is an aspiring writer, and an admirer of Virginia Woolf. In an attempt to complete her first novel, she takes a break from her job in London and goes home to the small seaside town where her family still lives. However, for Lily home is not simply a peaceful place to write, but part of the experience which she brings to bear on her writing.

results.title: Angel at my table: a trilogy [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jane Campion, Bridget Ikin and Hibiscus Films
results.brief_description: This trilogy re-creates the life of New Zealand’s prize winning author Janet Frame, based on her visions of herself and her times. The first part, ‘To the Is-Land’, deals with Janet’s childhood in Oamaru in the 1930’s. Part two, ‘An Angel at my Table’, is an account of her disturbing experiences after being committed to an institution. In the final part, ‘The Envoy from Mirror City’, after an uneasy fellowship with Europe’s artistic-set, Janet returns to New Zealand conveying a sense of confidence and hope. Adapted by Laura Jones from the three volumes of Frame’s autobiography. Starring Kerry Fox, Alexia Keogh and Karen Fergusson. Cinematography by Stuart Dryburgh.

results.title: Anastasia (1997) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Don Bluth, Gary Goldman and Fox Family Films (Twentieth Century Fox)
results.brief_description: Beginning with her early childhood in 1916 Russia, this $50 million fantasy recreates the story of the lost Russian Princess, Anastasia. Finding herself in an orphanage when the revolution forces her family into exile, Anastasia grows into a young woman called Anya with little memory of her past. Years later while in St Petersburg with her puppy, she meets a handsome man called Dimitri who takes her to Paris to reclaim her status as a Romanov. Anastasia and Dimitri have an instant affinity - having met years before, only neither of them remembers. Their journey to reach Paris and solve one of the greatest mysteries of the twentieth century is impeded by the evil monk Rasputin and his sidekick Bartok the bat. Fortunately there are plenty of lively songs and voice characterisation by prominent Hollywood stars to dispel any frightening outcomes. Voices are provided by Meg Ryan, John Cusack, Kelsey Grammer, Hank Azaria, Christopher Lloyd and Angela Lansbury. Anastasia’s songs are performed by Liz Callaway. Also available on VHS [311896]

results.title: Andy Warhol: the complete picture
results.creator_credit: Chris Radley, Fenton Bailey, Randy Barbato, Bravo Network and Channel Four
results.brief_description: Fascinating documentary about the life and work of one of the twentieth century’s most influential artists - Andy Warhol. Originally born Andrew Warhola to immigrant Slovakian parents, this tale starts with a history of his family life in Pittsburgh and travails his life’s work up to his death in 1987. Not unlike his films, the vision lingers on the exteriors of buildings, the beauty of the everyday through signs and architecture set against a moving sky. The facts are rendered easily to memory as the images are beautiful to watch and the narration by Julian Rhind-Tutt engaging. The only American artist to have a museum dedicated to him, Warhol’s obsessive behaviour in documenting his life (over 600 time capsules were created by the artist) fills the museum. His audio-tapes, art, magazine publishing, band and other enterprises are discussed through interviews with friends, family and fans and demonstrated by an elegant assemblage of photos and ephemera.

results.title: Andy Warhol: made in China
results.creator_credit: Lee Evan Caplin and Lee Caplin Productions
results.brief_description: This is a short documentary film, purportedly to be the last film of Andy Warhol before he died, which combines an insight into the world of Andy Warhol along with a travelogue of Hong Kong and China. Alfred Sui, an American educated Chinese who has lived in Hong Kong for twenty years, created the “I Club”, a glitzy disco nightclub located in the heart of Hong Kong’s financial district in the Bank of America building and fashioned in the western style of the New York nightclubs. The “I Club” represented modern western architecture and design and featured paintings by world renowned artists, including many of Andy Warhol’s work. Alfred Sui invited Andy Warhol and his entourage to open his new night club in 1985 which was to be patronised by the wealthy and famous, who wish to see and be seen. In the following days after the opening, Andy becomes a tourist visiting Peking, the Great Wall of China, Red Square but all the time comparing eastern culture with western culture and appearing to be mildly disappointed in the lack of westernization in China (no McDonalds!). Andy’s egocentricity also begins to surface as he realises that the Chinese really do not know who Andy Warhol is, that it is only American tourists who recognise him and want to take his photo. A strange but interesting doco with rare footage of a relaxed and open Andy Warhol.

results.title: Andrew Gaze: the perfect 10
results.brief_description: This is a biographical film about one of Australia’s great sporting heroes - in fact one of the world’s highest point scorer in the game of men’s basketball - Andrew Gaze. Born in Melbourne in 1965, Andrew spent his early years growing up in Albert Park, an area well-known for its sporting facilities from a basketball stadium to cricket, football, yachting and various other facilities. Andrew’s father, Lindsay, who himself was a champion basketballer, had a profound influence on Andrew as his coach and mentor and to this day, there is still a very close bond between the two of them. Down to earth, highly respected by his peers, Andrew talks of his highs and lows, his motivation to keep going even when the odds seem to be against him and his career which spans across three decades and includes representing Australia in several Olympic Games, playing for Seton Hall in the NCAA competition, San Antonio Spurs and the Washington Bullets in the NBA and of course the Melbourne Tigers in the NBA. Put together in chronological order with footage from some of his major games, this is an entertaining and informative video which also includes some humorous moments from “Gaze Cam”, Andrew’s own home video shots.

results.title: Andrea Chenier
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Burton, Michael Hampe, BBC-TV and National Video Corporation
results.brief_description: ‘Andrea Chenier’, opera in four acts, by Umberto Giordano with libretto by Luigi Illica was performed at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden by world-renowned opera singer Placido Domingo in the role of Andrea Chenier, supported by Bulgarian soprano, Anna Tomowa-Sintow as Maddalena di Coigny and Italian baritone, Giorgio Zancanaro as Gerard accompanied by The Royal Opera Chorus and The Orchestra of the Royal Opera House conducted by Julius Rudel. A tale of passion and revenge, love and death, set in Paris during the dangerous and uncertain times of the French Revolution. Sung in Italian. Guide included.
